comments:
I have been using M7 since the day it was released with no problems whatsoever,
I tried to start it up today and I get the following error:

Gnome 2.2 GTK 2.0

This is good information.  Seems like your .state file is corrupt somehow.  Are 
you willing to attach it to this bug report?  With that we can see why/where it 
is failing.  Note that we have seen things like this in the past and it has 
turned out to be an actual machine issues (bad sectors etc).

To get working, rename your configruation directory and then restart Eclipse.  
Please let us know if this does not work.

Created an attachment (id=8563)
The config / state file

> Seems like your .state file is corrupt somehow.  Are  you willing to attach it
to this bug report?

Sure, I had to reinstall everything because I use M7 to do my job (I know, I
know) - but I kept the old directory around so here you go

> To get working, rename your configruation directory and then restart Eclipse.  
Please let us know if this does not work. 

I already reinstalled it - sorry if I jumped the gun.

The state was corrupted indeed. It ends abruptly in the middle of the definition
of org.eclipse.tomcat's provided packages (after the 7th of 96!).

Unfortunately, it is just impossible to understand why it got corrupted. One
reason, file system curruption, is unlikely, since the file size would in that
case be on a cluster size boundary, and the file size is not a multiple of 512.

Probably something bad happened while shutting down in the previous session. We
have considerably improved the logging story since M7, so I woud expect more
meaningful information if it happens again with recent builds.

Closing as works for me since not reproducible. Please reopen if it happens
again. In that case, please preserve the config area (renaming) and the log file
so we may have better chances to figure this out. Thanks.
